name: 劉宛育
objective: Course description: The course attempts to give an introduction to important architectural thoughts, events and projects after modernism. From structuralism to blobitecture, each week a lecture referring to one specific topic including relevant materials will be given.
schedule:
Week 01　09/19: Introduction 
Week 02　09/26: Futurism & Expressionism
Week 03　10/03: Constructivism & Deconstructivism
Week 04　10/10: (國慶日放假一天)
Week 05　10/17: Structuralism & Metabolism
Week 06　10/24: Postmodernism & Post-postmodernism 
Week 07　10/31: Radical architecture
Week 08　11/07: Space age & Car culture
Week 09　11/14: (期中考週)
Week 10　11/21: Prefabrication
Week 11　11/28: Bionic architecture
Week 12　12/05: Blob architecture
Week 13　12/12: Blob architecture II
Week 14　12/19: Media architecture
Week 15　12/26: Contemporary architecture in Latin America
Week 16　01/02: Contemporary architecture in Asia and Africa
Week 17　01/09: Conclusion
Week 18　01/16: (期末考週)
scorePolicy:
Attendance: 40%
Mid-term Exam: 20% 
Writing: 30%
Final presentation: 10%
materials:
References:
Conrads, Ulrich (1975) Programs and Manifestoes on 20th-Century Architecture. The MIT Press.
Ockman, Joan (1993) Architecture Culture: 1943-1968. Rizzoli International Publications.
Jencks & Kropf (2006) Theories and Manifestoes of Contemporary Architecture (2nd ed.). Academy Press.
Hays, K. Michael (2000) Architecture Theory Since 1968. The MIT Press.
Nesbitt, Kate (1996) Theorizing a New Agenda for Architecture: An Anthology of Architectural Theory 1965-1995 (2nd ed.). Princeton Architectural Press.
Sykes & Hays (2010) Constructing a New Agenda: Architecture Theory 1993-2009. Princeton Architectural Press.
Braham & Hale (2006) Rethinking Technology: A Reader in Architectural Theory. Routledge.
Felicity D. Scott (2010) Architecture or Techno-utopia: Politics After Modernism. The MIT Press
Rafael Moneo (2004) Theoretical Anxiety and Design Strategies In the Work of Eight Contemporary Architects. ACTAR. 《哈佛大學建築系的八堂課》
